headline.print_headline: South Sudan Says Regains Key Town From Rebels, Uganda Claims Credit
headline.main: South Sudan Says Regains Key Town From Rebels, Uganda Claims Credit

docs.snippet: South Sudanese government forces said they seized the flashpoint town of Bor back from rebels on Saturday and Uganda's army claimed credit for the operation, highlighting the depth of its involvement in the conflict....
docs.lead_paragraph: South Sudanese government forces said they seized the flashpoint town of Bor back from rebels on Saturday and Uganda's army claimed credit for the operation, highlighting the depth of its involvement in the conflict.

headline.print_headline: Syria Offers Aleppo Truce as Rebels Argue Over Talks
headline.main: Syria Offers Aleppo Truce as Rebels Argue Over Talks

docs.snippet: The Syrian government, preparing for peace talks with rebels next week, handed the Russian co-sponsors of the conference a proposal on Friday for a ceasefire in Aleppo and an exchange of prisoners....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Syrian government, preparing for peace talks with rebels next week, handed the Russian co-sponsors of the conference a proposal on Friday for a ceasefire in Aleppo and an exchange of prisoners.

headline.print_headline: Feds Seek Option for Dredge Sand Along NC Beaches
headline.main: Feds Seek Option for Dredge Sand Along NC Beaches

docs.snippet: Beach communities and environmentalists are pushing back against a proposal to give the National Park Service the option of using dredging material to fight erosion on North Carolina's pristine Shackleford Banks, where wild horses roam and no huma...
docs.lead_paragraph: Beach communities and environmentalists are pushing back against a proposal to give the National Park Service the option of using dredging material to fight erosion on North Carolina's pristine Shackleford Banks, where wild horses roam and no humans live.

headline.print_headline: Syrian Opposition Says to Attend Talks, Backed by Rebel Fighters
headline.main: Syrian Opposition Says to Attend Talks, Backed by Rebel Fighters

docs.snippet: Syria's main political opposition group in exile agreed on Saturday to attend internationally sponsored peace talks, and said for the first time three rebel fighting forces also wanted to take part....
docs.lead_paragraph: Syria's main political opposition group in exile agreed on Saturday to attend internationally sponsored peace talks, and said for the first time three rebel fighting forces also wanted to take part.

headline.print_headline: Many Remain Wary of W.Va. Water as Smell Lingers
headline.main: Many Remain Wary of W.Va. Water as Smell Lingers

docs.snippet: The smell lingers — the slightly sweet, slightly bitter odor of a chemical that contaminated the water supply of West Virginia's capital more than a week ago. It creeps out of faucets and shower heads. It wafts from the Elk River, the site o...
docs.lead_paragraph: The smell lingers — the slightly sweet, slightly bitter odor of a chemical that contaminated the water supply of West Virginia's capital more than a week ago. It creeps out of faucets and shower heads. It wafts from the Elk River, the site of the spill. Sometimes it hangs in the cold nighttime air.
